main event: A strange object fell into Sardis Lake, Mississippi, prompting an investigation by U.S. Engineers and Air Force officials.
interesting points: The recovered object was about 10 plastic tubes, 30 inches long, fastened together with wires, and contained radio tubes and wires, resembling a scientific instrument or device.

The Greenville Air Force base identified the object as a Signal Corps radio transmitting device and determined that it was a paramotor transmitter lost from a training plane, likely falling by accident.
The object was initially reported by a fisherman and was eventually recovered after the reservoir's water receded, exposing it to view.
The investigation involved multiple agencies, including the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Air Force, indicating the significance and seriousness of the incident.
The incident occurred during a time when reports of unidentified objects in the papers were frequent, adding to the intrigue and interest in the case.
sighted object: strange object falling into Sardis Lake, Mississippi
witnesses: U.S. Engineers, Capt. Virgil Kuns, fisherman, and Air Force officials
